Global p-value generic

Source: R/global_pvalue_fun.R
global_pvalue_fun.Rd

An S3 generic that serves as the default for add_global_p(anova_fun).

The default function uses car::Anova() (via cardx::ard_car_anova()) to calculate the p-values.

Methods for GEE models (created from geepack::geeglm()) and completing risks regression (created from tidycmprsk::crr()) return Wald tests calculated using aod::wald.test() (via cardx::ard_aod_wald_test()). For these methods, the type argument is not used.

Usage

global_pvalue_fun(x, type, ...)

# S3 method for default
global_pvalue_fun(x, type, ...)

# S3 method for geeglm
global_pvalue_fun(x, type, ...)

# S3 method for tidycrr
global_pvalue_fun(x, type, ...)

Value

data frame

Examples

lm(age ~ stage + grade, trial) |>
  global_pvalue_fun(type = "III")
#> {cards} data frame: 15 x 8
#>       variable   context stat_name stat_label     stat fmt_fn
